intro: Tristemon stellatus, commonly known as the star-leaf tristemon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Tristemon stellatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
